result.execSummary:
The defendant Tamia M Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Misdemeanor Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Defendant to report to probation intake and provide DNA sample by 8/1/2022.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court WAIVES all non-mandatory court costs and fees.
Pay all mandatory supervision fees, court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA &DV surcharges during period of probation. Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.

NO VIOLENT CONTACT with K.C.
No coporal punishment of any kind.
No contact with firearms.
For reasons set forth on the record. Court GRANTS expungement IF the defendant completes ALL terms and conditions of probation in the time allotted.

Any programming already completed can apply, proof to be submitted to the agent.
Mental health evaluation, comply with recommended treatment.
Parenting classes.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tamia M Carter

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tamia M Carter in court with attorney Eric m Hailstock.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing. Arraignment held.  Original amended information has been e-filed; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading and pleads not guilty subject to the Court accepting change of plea today. Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea hearing held.  
  
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to AMENDED COUNTS 1 & 2.

Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Defendant Tamia M Carter in court with attorney Eric m Hailstock.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Defense requests resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 35 via zoom.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Tamia M Carter in court with attorney Eric m Hailstock.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 35.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 031513,
Payable Number: 996879,
Receipt Number: 22RP013393,
Amount: $20.00
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KC, pursuant to DMCPS and Children's Court order. If there is no plan in place, this is to revert to a NO VIOLENT contact order.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 04/02/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Tamia M Carter in court with attorney Eric m Hailstock.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Tamia M Carter
Current: 4961 N 47th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 03-31-2022)
Prior: 1306 North 21st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53205
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/31/22 @ 1:30p
